section.title: Purpose
section.p: If you want to delete a Translation Memory, using a command typed in your systemâ€™s command area instead of windows might be quicker and more convenient.

refsyn.title: Format
refsyn.p: The following syntax diagram describes how you delete a Translation Memory with the OTMBATCH command. Note that lowercase letters in a parameter name are optional and need not be typed.

section.title: Parameters

plentry.pd: MEMDEL specifies that you want to remove a Translation Memory.
Specifies the name of the Translation Memory that you want to remove.

If you specify this parameter, you are not prompted with any message window. If you do not specify this parameter, a message window pops up whenever an error occurs or when the task has successfully completed.

section.note: You can type the commands in uppercase, lowercase, or in mixed-case letters. You may not use any wildcard characters, such as an asterisk (*).
